topic.title: About Your User List
topic.p:
The User List displays all of the user accounts configured on your server. The disk space usage statistics for the entire server appear at
the top-right.

ul.li: If you enable the Mail privilege for any user, you create a mailbox on the server for them.

If you enable FTP access for any user, you give them access to a personal home directory for file storage on the domain, and the ability to transfer files to and from the directory using an FTP client.
If you enable Shell access for any user, you allow them to access the command line interface through an SSH client or Telnet client.

section-list.title: Using the View User List Window

ol.title: To add a Domain Administrator:
ol.p: Important: In order to keep your passwords secure, you should always log in to your Control Panel via https, not http.

Note: There are many more privileges you can assign to a domain administrator than you can to an end user. Carefully choose what level of authority you want to grant to your sub-users. You can edit and delete users and domain administrators from the same windows.

li.p: In the User Management menu group, click Add Domain Admin (expand the menu group to see the links, if necessary). For more information about expanding and collapsing menu groups, see Menus and Navigation.
The Add Domain Admin: Profile page appears.

ol.li: Type the new user's full name in the Full Name field.
Type the user's login ID in the Login ID field.
Type the user's password in the Password field.
Type the user's password again in the Confirm Password field.

li.p: Type the user's disk space quota (in MB).
Note: If you give 0 MB of disk space to a user, the user will not have a disk space quota. Usage will only be limited by the quota of the Server Admin or Domain Admin.

ol.li: Select the Mail Administration Authorization Rights to promote the End User to a Mail Administrator (or deselect the checkbox to demote a Mail Administrator to an End User).

Select the privileges (Mail, FTP Access, Shell Access, etc) that you want for this user.
Note: Granting FTP privilege to domain administrators provides FTP access to the document root for each domain in their account.
Note: If you selected Shell Access, select the default user shell from the Shell Access drop-down list.
Select the privileges (Mail, FTP Access, Shell Access, etc) you wish to allow this domain admin to offer to end users.

To add a prefix to the username of all users created by this domain admin, type the desired prefix in the End User Prefix field.
Note: Only use alphanumeric characters as well as _, -, and . in prefixes. Usernames are limited to 16 characters, including prefix. Only the System Administrator can create and change the prefix associated with domain administrators.
Type the first domain name this domain admin will administer in the Domain field.
Select the IP address for the domain from the IP Address drop-down menu.
Type any comments for this user in the Comments field.

Click Next. The Mail Setup window appears containing the Mailbox Name for the domain administrator, an associated email address, and a Mail Applications section that enables you to turn on or off the Webmail client, filtering, and antivirus features.
If you wish to change the default email address, type a different address in the Email Address field.

If you wish to change the default mail applications, de-select the checkboxes for Webmail client, SpamAssassin, and/or Clam
Antivirus.

Click Next. The Domain Setup window appears containing the Domain Alias option, the Web Services options, the End
Users options, the Email Addresses options, the Website Logs options, the Domain Contact, and Mail Catchall options.

Select Enable www domain alias if you want to ensure that domain administrators typing the www. prefix or just
typing the domain name will arrive at the domain you have created.

Select CGI or SSL if you want the domain administrator to be able to use either
feature.

Type the number of email addresses the domain administrator can create by in the Maximum number of email addresses
field, or allow the domain administrator an unlimited number by selecting the other option in this section.
Select Do not create or store website logs if you do not want logs created for the domain administrator's site.
Select Create and store website logs if you want logs created for the domain administrator's site.

Select Never rotate website logs if you do not want new logs created at intervals for the domain administrator's
site.

Select Rotate and click the drop-down arrows to specify the interval you want to rotate and the number of days you
want to save logs for the domain administrator's site.
Select Reject mail if you want all misdirected mail returned to sender with an unknown user message.

Select Silently discard mail if you want all misdirected mail deleted without a message returned to
sender.

Select Deliver mail to Domain Admin if you want all misdirected mail sent to the domain administrator's
address.

Select Deliver mail to: if you want all misdirected mail sent to an email address you type in the Deliver
mail to: field.
Click Next. The Add Domain Admin: Preview window appears with all of the options you have chosen.
Click Previous if you want to go back and make changes.
Click Save if you want to save the information.
Click Save and Create Another if you want to save the information and create another domain administrator.
Click Cancel if you want to cancel your changes.

ol.title: To add an End User:
ol.p: Important: In order to keep your passwords secure, you should always log in to your Control Panel via https, not http.

li.p: In the User Management menu group, click Add End User (expand the menu group to see the links, if necessary). For more information about expanding and collapsing menu groups, see Menus and Navigation.
The Add End User Profile page appears.

ol.li: Type the new user's full name in the Full Name field.

Type the user's login ID in the Login ID field.
Note: If a prefix has been configured for the domain admin, then it is indicated above the Login ID field. Usernames are limited to 16 characters, including prefix. The Login ID must be a unique name. If it matches a name you have already submitted for another user, the control panel displays an error message when you try to submit the name.
Type the user's password in the Password field.
Type the user's password again in the Confirm Password field.

li.p: Type the user's disk space quota (in MB).
Note: If you give 0 MB of disk space to a user, the user will not have a disk space quota. Usage will only be limited by the quota of the Server Admin or Domain Admin.

ol.li: Select the privileges (Mail, FTP Access, Shell Access) that you want for this user.
If you selected Shell Access, select the shell you want from the Shell Access drop-down list.
Select the user's associated domain from the Domain drop-down list.
Click Next. If the user has mail privileges, the Add End User Mail Setup window appears with the mailbox name and email address in the appropriate fields.
Select the Mail applications (Webmail, SpamAssassin, Clam AntiVirus) you want for this user.

Click Next. The Add End User Preview window appears displaying the information you have selected for this user. If all the information is correct, go to the next step. To change the Mail Applications information, click Previous and make the desired changes, then click Next to go to the Preview window. To change any other information, click Previous twice to get to the Profile window and make any desired changes, then click Next twice to go to the Preview window.
Click Save. The User List window appears with a message informing you that the user has been added.

ol.title: To Delete an End User:

li.p: In the User Management menu group, click User List (expand the menu group to see the links, if necessary). For more information about expanding and collapsing menu groups, see Menus and Navigation.
Note: You can only delete users for whom the “delete” option is active.

ol.li:
Select the domain you want from the Display Users of drop-down list and click Go. The User List window for the
selected domain appears.
Select the checkbox for the user you want to delete.
Click Delete. A message appears asking if you are sure you want to delete this user.
Click OK. A message appears informing you that the selected user has been deleted.

ol.title: To Disable a User:

li.p: In the User Management menu group, click User List (expand the menu group to see the links, if necessary). For more information about expanding and collapsing menu groups, see Menus and Navigation.

ol.li:
Select the domain you want from the Display Users of drop-down list and click Go. The User List window for the
selected domain appears.

Click disable for the user you want to disable. A message appears asking if you are sure you want to disable
this user.

Click OK. The word "disabled" appears in the Status column and a message appears informing you that the user has
been disabled.

ol.title: To Edit an End User:

li.p: In the User Management menu group, click User List (expand the menu group to see the links, if necessary). For more information about expanding and collapsing menu groups, see Menus and Navigation.

ol.li:
Select the domain you want from the Display Users of drop-down list and click Go. The User List window for the
selected domain appears.
Click Properties for the user you want to edit. The Properties window appears.
Next to Profile, click Edit. The Edit Profile window for the selected user appears.
If you want to change the password, type the user's new password in the Password and Confirm Password fields.

li.p: Type the user's new disk space quota (in MB).
Note: If you give 0 MB of disk space to a user, the user will not have a disk space quota. Usage will only be limited by the quota of the Server Admin or Domain Admin.

ol.li: Check the privileges (Mail, FTP Access, Shell Access) that you want for this user.
If you selected Shell Access, select the shell you want from the Shell Access drop-down list.
Select the user's associated domain from the Domain drop-down list.
Click Save. The Properties window appears with a message informing you that the domain has been changed.

To edit the mail settings, next to Mail Setup, click Edit. The Edit Mail Setup window for the selected domain
appears.
Select the mail applications (Webmail, SpamAssassin, Clam AntiVirus) you want for this user.
Click Save. The Properties window appears with a message informing you that the domain has been changed.

ol.title: To Enable a User:

li.p: In the User Management menu group, click User List (expand the menu group to see the links, if necessary). For more information about expanding and collapsing menu groups, see Menus and Navigation.

ol.li:
Select the domain you want from the Display Users of drop-down list and click Go. The User List window for the
selected domain appears.

Click enable for the user you want to enable. The word "enabled" appears in the Status column and a message
appears informing you that the user has been enabled.
